GLOBAL:SOFAConventions.comment: This conventions stores directivities of acoustic sources (instruments, loudspeakers, singers, talkers, etc) in the frequency domain for multiple musical notes in free field.

GLOBAL:RoomType.comment: The room information can be arbitrary, but the spatial setup assumes free field.

GLOBAL:License.default: No license provided, ask the author for permission

GLOBAL:DatabaseName.comment: Name of the database. Used for classification of the data

GLOBAL:Musician.comment: Narrative description of the musician such as position, behavior, or personal data if not data-protected, e.g., 'Christiane Schmidt sitting on the chair', or 'artificial excitation by R2D2'.

GLOBAL:Description.comment: Narrative description of a measurement. For musical instruments/singers, the note (C1, D1, etc) or the dynamic (pp., ff., etc), or the string played, the playing style (pizzicato, legato, etc.), or the type of excitation (e.g., hit location of a cymbal). For loudspeakers, the system and driver units.

GLOBAL:SourceType.comment: Narrative description of the acoustic source, e.g., 'Violin', 'Female singer', or '2-way loudspeaker'

GLOBAL:SourceManufacturer.comment: Narrative description of the manufacturer of the source, e.g., 'Stradivari, Lady Blunt, 1721' or 'LoudspeakerCompany'

ListenerPosition.comment: Position of the microphone array during the measurements.

ListenerUp.comment: Up vector of the microphone array

ReceiverPosition.comment: Positions of the microphones during the measurements (relative to the Listener)

SourcePosition:Reference.comment: Narrative description of the spatial reference of the source position, e.g., for the trumpet, 'The bell'. Mandatory in order to provide a reference across different instruments

SourceView:Reference.comment: Narrative description of the spatial reference of the source view, e.g., for the trumpet, 'Viewing direction of the bell'. Mandatory in order to provide a reference across different instruments

SourceUp.comment: Up vector of the acoustic source (instrument)

SourceUp:Reference.comment: Narrative description of the spatial reference of the source up, e.g., for the trumpet, 'Along the keys, keys up'. Mandatory in order to provide a reference across different instruments

EmitterPosition.comment: A more detailed structure of the Source. In a simple settings, a single Emitter is considered that is collocated with the source.

EmitterDescription.comment: A more detailed structure of the source. In a simple setting, a single Emitter is considered that is collocated with the source. In a more complicated setting, this may be the strings of a violin or the units of a loudspeaker.

MIDINote.comment: Defines the note played by the source during the measurement. The note is specified a MIDI note by the [https://www.midi.org/specifications-old/item/the-midi-1-0-specification MIDI specifications, version 1.0]. Not mandatory, but recommended for tonal instruments.

Description.comment: This variable is used when the description varies with M.

SourceTuningFrequency.comment: Frequency (in Hertz) to which a musical instrument is tuned to corresponding to the note A4 (MIDINote=69). Recommended for tonal instruments.

Data.Real.comment: Real part of the complex spectrum. The default value 0 indicates that all data fields are initialized with zero values.

Data.Imag.comment: Imaginary part of the complex spectrum
